Name: Amanda Richter
Title: Office Manager
Bio: Amanda Richter is an Office Manager located at Auburn University, where she runs the day to day operations of the center. In the 2 years Amanda has been with ATN – Auburn University, she has increased the efficiency of the office, developed new course content and begun facilitating training, an achievement made possible by her dedication to continuous improvement. Prior to joining ATN, Amanda spent 5 years as the HR Administrator for Island Hospitality, where she acquired skills in onboarding team members, facilitating training and event planning. Amanda is certified in the following: A graduate from Palm Beach Atlantic University, Amanda holds a degree in Psychology. When not hard at ATN - Auburn University, she enjoys being outdoors and spending time with her sons, Christian and Noah.

Name: David Hicks
Title: Outreach Faculty Member
Bio: David Hicks is an Outreach Faculty member at Alabama Technology Network (ATN) – Auburn University, where he assists organizational leaders in strategic planning, improvement implementation, team member coaching & development, and creating intentional cultures. Including his 15 years with ATN, Hicks has over 30 years of experience in manufacturing, quality and statistics, training, test engineering, plant management and research & development. David is certified in the following: A graduate from the University of Alabama Huntsville, David holds a Master’s degree in Engineering.

Name: Hank Czarnecki
Title: Center Director
Bio: Hank Czarnecki is the Director at Alabama Technology Network (ATN)-Auburn University, where he works to strategically transform companies by using the Kata methodology to develop a sustainable, problem solving culture. In 25 years with ATN, Czarnecki has trained and coached thousands of professionals to develop strong critical thinking skills and disciplined improvement habits. Prior to joining ATN, Hank was a Process Engineer for ArvinMeritor, responsible for implementing the Arvin Total Quality Production System. Hank Czarnecki is certified in the following: A graduate from both Auburn University and the University of Pittsburgh, Hank holds a Master’s and Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering

Name: Alan Hill
Title: Executive Director
Bio: Alan Hill is the Executive Director of the Alabama Productivity Center (APC), which is an outreach center of The University of Alabama’s Culverhouse College of Business.  APC is a University partner of the Alabama Technology Network and serves as the ATN-Tuscaloosa Center. Before joining The University of Alabama in 2012, Alan served as a Project Engineer and the Center Director for the Alabama Technology Network’s Birmingham Center for 14 years.  Prior to that, he worked in the industrial equipment manufacturing and aerospace industries for 11 years.  He served in both project leadership and quality assurance roles. He holds certifications in Quality Management Systems (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, IATF 16949, and AS9100) and Lean Manufacturing. He also holds a Six Sigma Black Belt. A graduate from the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB), Alan earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering as well as a Master of Engineering degree in Information and Engineering Management.  In his spare time, he enjoys working on his antique project car and traveling with his family.

Name: Jan Ingenrieth
Title: Business Services Specialist
Bio: Jan Brazeal Ingenrieth is a Business Services Specialist for the Alabama Productivity Center (APC), which is an outreach center of The University of Alabama’s Culverhouse College of Business. APC is a University partner of the Alabama Technology Network and serves as the ATN-Tuscaloosa Center. Jan joined the Alabama Productivity Center in 2014 and currently provides training and development for businesses throughout Alabama. She also manages and coaches’ students in the statewide APC Internship Program. Prior to working with the APC, Jan started her professional career in the staffing industry where she managed industrial accounts for the franchise before becoming Operations Manager. During her career in staffing, she supervised up to 350 temporary employees, managed assignments for more than 50 clients with sales of $1 M and managed an internal staff of five. She left staffing and joined the Automotive Industry as a Human Resource Manager of a start-up operation. For the next 11 years, Jan worked in the Automotive Industry as a Human Resource & Safety Manager with increasingly responsible roles for Tier I automotive manufacturers supplying Mercedes, Volkswagen and BMW. Jan is a Certified Leadership Trainer and Coach through the John C. Maxwell Leadership program and is a SHRM Senior Certified Professional. Jan earned a Bachelor of Arts in Communication and Master of Arts in Community Counseling from the University of Alabama. Jan is a member of the Church of the Highlands and enjoys travel, photography and arts and crafts.

Name: Susan Maples
Title: Productivity Engineer
Bio: Susan Maples is a Productivity Engineer for the Alabama Productivity Center, a part of the Culverhouse College of Business at the University of Alabama. Susan graduated from the University of Kentucky College of Engineering with a B.S. in Electrical Engineering. She began her professional career with Toyota Motor Manufacturing in Georgetown, Kentucky. During her time at Toyota, she worked in the Paint Shop as a Process Engineer and New Model Engineer establishing in-process quality systems, introducing new materials/equipment, and developing countermeasures for pre-production and production issues. She also held management positions in Production and Production Engineering, focusing on standardization and cost reduction. She was trained under a Japanese sensei and acquired a strong foundation in the Toyota Production System. Susan also worked at Michelin Tire (BFGoodrich division) in Tuscaloosa in the roles of Industrial Engineer and Business Unit Leader, leading continuous improvement activities and coaching and developing operators. After Michelin, she was an Industrial Engineer with Industrial Automotive Components focusing on plant flow and layout improvements. Susan received her Green Belt Certification during her time at Michelin. She is a member of the Society of Women Engineers and the Society of Manufacturing Engineers. Susan joined the Alabama Productivity Center in 2023 bringing her lean manufacturing experience to this position. She enjoys spending her spare time traveling and with her husband and four children.

Name: Justin Rodgers
Title: Productivity Engineer
Bio: Justin Rodgers is a Productivity Engineer I for the Alabama Productivity Center (APC), a part of the University of Alabama, in the Mobile area. He graduated from the school of College of Human Environmental Sciences with a B.S. in Hospitality Management in 2016. He began as a business administration student intern for Evonik Industries in 2015 and 2016, a multinational specialty chemical manufacture serving the automotive, plastics, pharmaceutical and other industries in Mobile, AL. Also, in 2015 and 2016, Justin was an intern for the Tuscaloosa County Industrial County Authority completing a county-wide hourly wage survey for Tuscaloosa County in the manufacture industry and doing market research for the county as well. He also served as an intern for the Alabama Productivity Center in 2016 where he worked on multiple projects and researched marketing materials for the center. Justin joined the Alabama Productivity Center in 2017 with the vision of expanding the center’s services and internship programs in the greater Mobile, AL area. Located at the GulfQuest Maritime Museum in Mobile, AL, Justin is the first APC alum to join the staff and has worked on various projects in Health & Safety, process improvement and problem solving through the APC since 2017. A personal goal of Justin’s is to be able to retain recent college graduates from the State of Alabama to stay in Alabama’s workforce after graduation.

Name: Tara Johnson
Title: Business Manager
Bio: Tara Johnson is the Business Manager of the Alabama Productivity Center (APC), which is an outreach center of The University of Alabama’s Culverhouse College of Business.  APC is a University partner of the Alabama Technology Network and serves as the ATN-Tuscaloosa Center. Tara began her professional career with Chuck's Fish Restaurant in Tuscaloosa. She started as a server when no management positions were available, and within one year was the Event Coordinator/Front of House Manager. She carried this position as well as the eventual General Manager position for over 4 years. Her most recent position was working with McGiffert and Associates, LLC as an Administrative Assistant. At McGiffert and Associates, LLC, she served as the point of contact for all contract management. This included reviewing proposals, data mining for said proposals, training employees, typesetting, and budget management. Tara earned a Bachelor of Business Administration from The University of West Alabama, where she was very active in S.I.F.E., ODK, and Phi Mu Fraternity, and joined the Alabama Productivity Center in March of 2021. She is currently serving the community as Secretary of the Tuscaloosa Area Phi Mu Alumnae chapter, founding member of Young Tuscaloosa, and Project Leader for Operation Christmas Child at Indian Lake Baptist Church. She enjoys spending her spare time outdoors with her husband and son.

Name: Morgan Harrison
Title: Productivity Engineer II
Bio: Morgan Harrison is a Productivity Engineer II at the Alabama Productivity Center (APC), which is an outreach center of The University of Alabama’s Culverhouse College of Business.  APC is a University partner of the Alabama Technology Network and serves as the ATN-Tuscaloosa Center. Before joining The University of Alabama in 2019, Morgan served as the Manager of Database Operations at Summit Engineering Services, an AT&T Contractor company, for 12 years.  Her work also included project management, reviewing and approving invoices, training employees in the use of various databases, and maintaining access control for many AT&T databases.  While at Summit Engineering Services, she took on the additional role of Quality Control Specialist, conducting quality reviews of outside plant engineering jobs.  Her work also included designing and drafting fiber telecommunication jobs.  Prior to that, she worked in the industrial engineering department at Michelin. A graduate from The University of Alabama, Morgan earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Industrial Engineering.  In her spare time, she enjoys volunteering with the Junior League and traveling to the beach with her family.

Name: Ben Baxter
Title: Productivity Engineer
Bio: Ben Baxter is a Productivity Engineer for the Alabama Productivity Center, a part of the Culverhouse College of Business at The University of Alabama. Ben is a 2010 graduate of The University of Alabama with a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering. Ben would later continue his education by earning a Master of Business Administration in 2016 from Troy University. During his time as a UA undergraduate, Ben was a three-time intern with Southern Nuclear at Farley Nuclear Plant in southeast Alabama. Upon graduation from UA, Ben accepted an offer to return to Southern Nuclear as a Program Engineer who primarily managed the on-going effects of flow-accelerated corrosion on steam and water piping systems. Following his time in the nuclear industry, Ben would move back to Tuscaloosa and spend over five years as a Quality Engineer in the automotive supplier world. In this role, he would serve southern automaker customers such as Volkswagen Chattanooga Assembly Plant, Mercedes-Benz U.S. International, and Honda Manufacturing of Alabama. With the experience Ben gained in automotive, he would transition into quality assurance leadership with two certified ISO 9001 companies—HarbisonWalker International and Avient Corporation. Ben joined APC in 2023 bringing his skills in quality assurance, continuous improvement, and proactive safety to this position. He is also an active community member, being an active participant in Leadership Tuscaloosa Alumni Association and Tuscaloosa County UA Alumni Chapter. Lastly, Ben is an elder and member at Hope City Church Tuscaloosa, and he enjoys traveling the fifty states with his wife, Alyson, and their two daughters.

Name: Allison Moore
Title: Research Associate
Bio: Allison Moore is a Research Associate at the Huntsville office of the Alabama Technology Network (ATN). She is responsible for organizing the finances and contracts of the Huntsville ATN center through account management and handles office management support. Allison has been with ATN for fifteen years.  She has over eighteen years working in financial contracts and grants.  A graduate from the University of Alabama in Huntsville (UAH), Allison Moore holds a degree in Finance. When not hard at work doing office and account management, she enjoys photography and spending time with her three children.

Name: Emily Pate
Title: Marketing Specialist
Bio: Emily Pate is the marketing specialist at the Huntsville office of the Alabama Technology Network (ATN). She is responsible for marketing the Huntsville office services to small to medium size businesses by handling the digital aspects of marketing for the center as well as supporting the project engineers. Emily has been with ATN for five years.  Pate has seven years of experience working in marketing. She has earned two bachelor’s degrees --- Marketing and Studio Art, an achievement made possible by her digital media skill set. A graduate from the University of Alabama in Huntsville (UAH), Emily Pate holds degrees in Marketing and Studio Art. When not hard at work doing marketing, she enjoys collecting and researching historical photography.

Name: Jeff Thompson
Title: Research Scientist VI
Bio: Jeffis an experienced business development professional working with small and medium-sized enterprises in urban and rural areas of Alabama.  His work includes specialized industry research to assist communities, government organizations and private companies with growth initiatives.  Projects include economic impact analyses, industry profiles, innovation market research, and strategic planning for all types of organizations. Jeff is experienced in economic development, corporate finance, management consulting, applied research, and managing business organizations.  He has served in the roles of chief operations officer, executive director of an industry association, director of small business development, manager of small business and research programs, corporate financial planning, and research scientist.  He regularly interacts with local businesses and business groups in north Alabama. Jeff holds an M.B.A. from the University of Alabama in Birmingham and a B.S. in accounting from the University of Alabama.

Name: Karen Yarbrough
Title: Senior Business Advisor within the Center for Management & Economic Research
Bio: Ms. Yarbrough is the Senior Business Advisor within the Center for Management & Economic Research.  She specializes in marketing research, strategic business communications, and management consulting. She has served in the role of president, chief financial officer, and partner in several marketing and management consulting companies. She has worked with a range of clients from high-tech computer and engineering companies to small retail operations since 1982.  Yarbrough holds a B.A. in Communications from the University of Alabama.

Name: Nicholas Loyd, PhD
Title: Center Director
Bio: Nicholas Loyd is the Huntsville Center Director for the Alabama Technology Network. Nic has served as a field engineer for ATN and still enjoys projects on a part-time basis. He also serves as the Director of the Center for Management and Economic Research (CMER) at The University of Alabama in Huntsville (UAH). Nic has worked with ATN for twenty years implementing lean production, leadership development, and strategic transformation. His work has spanned a variety of industries including automotive, aerospace, medical, steel fabrication and distribution, education, and government. Nic has played a key role in pioneering the development of lean services for seaport operations. Nic is a clinical assistant professor for the Industrial and Systems Engineering and Engineering Management (ISEEM) department at UAH, with primary responsibility in leading the Engineering Management graduate program. His primary research interests are lean production, strategic management and culture change, supply chain management, and emerging technologies in manufacturing. Nicholas Loyd is certified in the following: Nic has a bachelor’s degree in Industrial and Systems Engineering, a master’s degree in Engineering Management, and a PhD in Industrial Engineering from UAH.  When not hard at work, he enjoys his bulldogs, Brazilian jiu jitsu, and playing drums.

Name: Pam Elrod
Title: Office Manager
Bio:
Pam Elrod is the office manager for Muscle Shoals, Opelika, and Rainsville centers where she works to manage day-to-day operations of the Centers; maintains appropriate office policies and procedures; processes and monitor training and project contracts/accounts; assists central office with accounts payable.
In 20 years with ATN, Ms. Elrod has 27 years of experience in office administration. In 2019, she received the ACCS Chancellors award, an achievement made possible by her ongoing work ethic and upbeat attitude.
Pam holds a degree in Business Administration (BBA) from the University of North Alabama. When not at work, she enjoys spending time with her family and twins, Tanner and Taylor.

Name: Paul Wilhite
Title: Program/Technology Manager
Bio:
Paul Wilhite is a Program/Technology Manager where he works to provide training and technical assistance in industrial maintenance.
Paul has 23 years with ATN and has 33 years’ total experience in manufacturing, primarily in a machining environment.
Prior to joining ATN, Paul was the Senior Manufacturing Engineer for Copeland Corporation and responsible for continuous improvement and capital projects for the machining portion of the plant as well as assisting with production problems and maintaining equipment. While there, he also assisted with two new product launches.
A graduate from Auburn University with a BS in Mechanical Engineering and the University of Alabama at Birmingham with a Master of Business Administration.

Name: Nathan Bergquist
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Nathan Bergquist is a Project Engineer that works to support manufacturing, provide technical assistance, and improve safety for companies in Alabama.
Prior to joining ATN, Nathan was a Drilling Engineer for ExxonMobil and worked in the oilfield on three continents as well as worked for a sheet metal manufacture as a Design Engineer.
A graduate from the University of Alabama – Huntsville and Auburn University, Nathan holds a master’s degree in Electrical Engineering and a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering. When not supporting manufacturing in Alabama thru his work at ATN, Nathan works on the family farm.

Name: Paige K. Caulfield
Title: Marketing & PR Manager
Bio:
As the Marketing and Public Relations Manager, Paige Caulfield is diligent and committed to her profession. With over 15 years of experience, she joined Alabama Technology Network (ATN) in November 2019 and quickly took ATN by storm.
Through her chief ambition to one day control the internet, Paige busies herself by providing technical and professional support in developing, designing, and producing written and graphic products for recruitment, advertising, ATN website, and social media presence.
In addition to holding a B.S. in business administration with an emphasis in marketing from Faulkner University, Paige has completed several Web development-related courses, including topics such as HTML, Flash ActionScripting, JavaScript, Photography, Video Production, and Blogging 101.
Before coming on board ATN, Paige served as the Director of Events and Marketing with Manufacture Alabama.
Paige is an avid sports fan. In her spare time, she enjoys impromptu singing and dancing, making others laugh, and spending time with her family. Paige is married with two children and lives a beautiful life of chaos.

Name: Mark Thompson
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Mark Thompson is a Project Engineer where he works to teach and implement continuous improvement solutions by utilizing methodologies such as lean manufacturing and six sigma.  He also teaches quality-related tools and implements management systems.
Mark has over 25 years of experience facilitating kaizen events using tools such as 5S, single minute exchange of die (SMED), standard work, point-of-use storage (POUS), and value stream mapping.  He is also proficient with automotive core tools such as SPC, MSA, FMEA, and DOE.  
Prior to joining ATN, Mark Thompson was the Quality Assurance Manager for Superior Manufacturing Group and responsible for continuous improvement and the quality/environmental management systems at the Moselle and Calhoun facilities. While there, he achieved, by working as part of a cross-functional team, throughput increases, scrap reduction, and working to maintain the appropriate levels of inventory within the Moselle and Calhoun facilities utilizing continuous improvement methodologies.   
Mark Thompson is certified in the following:         
Six Sigma Black Belt
Lean Bronze
ASQ Certified Quality Auditor
ISO 9001 Lead Auditor
Engineering Intern, EI-6712
A graduate from Mississippi State University, Mark Thompson holds a Master of Science and Bachelor of Science degrees in Industrial Engineering. When not hard at work, he enjoys spending time with his wife and three children, all things soccer, reading, and actively putting his Catholic faith in action by volunteering his time at his church and community.

Name: Michael Reaves
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Michael Reaves is a Project Engineer where he works to help small and medium manufacturing facilities by training their employees to work safer. This save companies money by having reduced work-related accidents costs and savings from OSHA penalties.
Including 2 years with ATN, Michael has 15 years of experience. He also has many certifications, an achievement made possible by his many years of safety training and on-the-job experience.
Prior to joining ATN, Michael was a Project Manager for AIDT and responsible for primarily overseeing the FreightCar America/Navistar/Alabama Steel Car project in the Shoals area.
Michael is certified in the following:         
OSHA 10 General Industry Trainer
OSHA 30 General Industry Trainer
HAZWOPER 40 Waste Site Worker Trainer
HAZWOPER 24 Spill Response Technician Trainer
HAZWOPER 8 Refresher Trainer
PIT Trainer
Overhead Crane Trainer
A graduate from Jacksonville State University, Michael holds a master’s degree in Computer Science. When not hard at work, he enjoys spending time with his grandchildren and selling Dinky Donuts at street fairs and festivals.

Name: Jody Upchurch
Title: Director of Finance and Accounting
Bio:
Jody Upchurch serves as the Director of Finance and Accounting based in Montgomery. Jody is responsible for the overall financial operations of ATN, including accounting and reporting.
For the last 12 years, Upchurch has provided leadership and supervision of personnel for fiscal operations, including general accounting, payroll, purchasing, and asset management. In addition, he coordinates the annual audit, monitors fiscal policies and procedures, and prepares annual and interim financial statements for ATN and appropriate state and federal agencies.
Jody has over 25 years of experience with the Alabama Community College System and oversees the purchasing function in accordance with the Alabama Competitive Bid Law.
A graduate from the Auburn University of Montgomery, Jody holds a bachelor's in finance and master’s in business administration. Outside of work, Jody enjoys being with his family at the lake, golfing, and reading a good book. He is married with two boys and a devoted Alabama fan.

Name: Joey Massey
Title: MEP Program Director
Bio:
Since 2018, Joey Massey has served as the MEP Program Director.  Alabama Technology Network is the recipient of the NIST Manufacturing Extension Partnership Award for the State of Alabama.  Joey is responsible for managing all aspects of this award.  Some of these responsibilities include budgeting, financial planning, project analysis, and reporting.
Joey has a BS in Applied Science from the University of Alabama and has worked for ATN since 2001.  His previous positions with ATN have included Field Engineer, Technical Specialist, and ERP System Administrator.

Name: John Espy
Title: IT Technology Manager
Bio:
John Espy is the IT Technology Manager where he works to support and secure ATN’s internal network infrastructure.
In the last 20 years with ATN, Espy has facilitated the MCSE training program at Wallace College and taught numerous Microsoft certification programs for businesses and industries in Alabama. He has also spearheaded a number of special projects including the advancement of wireless technologies in remote areas. In addition, he is currently working to protect ATN from cybersecurity threats.
Prior to joining ATN, Espy was the Math and Computer Science teacher for The Lakeside School in Eufaula, Alabama. While there, he achieved Teacher of the Year and coached Junior Varsity football.
Espy achieved the following certifications:
MCP- Microsoft Certified Professional
MCSE - Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer
MCT- Microsoft Certified Trainer
A graduate of Auburn University, John Espy holds a degree in Math and Computer Science. When not hard at work, he enjoys saltwater fishing and watching college football.

Name: Jon Bowen
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Jon Bowen is a Project Engineer based in Gadsden, where he works to assist clients in profitability and sustainability by providing training and technical assistance.
Bowen has been with ATN for 14 years and has an additional 23 years’ experience in engineering and industrial maintenance.  Bowen provides training in Industrial Maintenance, OSHA, and Lean.   
Prior to joining ATN, Bowen was a Project/Mechanical Engineer for Goodyear Tire & Rubber and was responsible for engineering duties in the Curing/Final Finish area of the plant. While there, he helped maintain the tire curing presses and final finish machines by working with general maintenance mechanics and electricians and installed many new and transferred pieces of equipment.
Bowen has been a member of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers for 37 years and has been an OSHA authorized General Industry Trainer for 14 years.
A graduate from Auburn University, Bowen has a degree in Mechanical Engineering. When not hard at work providing training and assistance to clients, he enjoys outdoor activities such as hunting, fishing, and boating.

Name: Keith Phillips
Title: Executive Director
Bio:
Keith Phillips serves as the Executive Director where he takes the goals and vision of ATN and makes them a reality with a commitment to assist the workforce development efforts in the state.
Keith began his career with ATN in 2009, where he served as the Eufaula Center Director. Due to his inspirational leadership and financial information that levers business, he was promoted to Director of Operations in 2015.
Respected as a voice in decision making, strategic business moves, and establishing governance boundaries, Keith rose to be Interim President in 2016.
Today as Executive Director, Phillips oversees the operations of a ten million-plus network. He uses a strong work ethic and dedication to spearhead major strategic shifts for transforming the workforce from a functional focus to innovation for the business and integrates ATN so that it supports the state of Alabama.
Previously, as City President, Phillips led business development for MidSouth Bank. He managed continued growth of the bank’s portfolio of loans and deposits and employees in the Barbour County market utilizing company guidelines, policies, and procedures and by establishing annual goals and budgets.
Keith holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Agribusiness Education from Auburn University and an Associate degree in Science from Wallace Community College. When not hard at work representing Alabama Technology Network in the state, Keith enjoys spending time at home with his family and hunting.

Name: Kelley Carden Strength
Title: Office Manager
Bio:
Kelley Carden Strength serves as Office Manager for the Alexander City and Gadsden centers, where she utilizes her exceptional office management skills to provide support to directors, field staff, and corporate office. Kelley’s responsibilities are to facilitate smooth day to day office operations including AP/AR, clerical support, inventory and database management, state and federal reporting, working with clients, and host colleges, all while adhering to ATN’s quality objectives.
In 19 years with Alabama Technology Network, Kelley has been dedicated to the mission of helping provide superior training and support to Alabama Manufacturers’. Kelley is a member of the Leadership and Management Development Team where she contributes years of corporate teambuilding experience. She also works closely with the EH&S, Industrial Maintenance, and Quality Teams. Kelley utilizes this experience with ATN to build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing clients.
Prior to ATN, Kelley developed exceptional communication, sales, and administrative skills from years in the education, hospitality, and retail industries.
On her personal time, Kelley most enjoys spending time with her family and doing things in the great outdoors.

Name: Larry Courington
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Larry E. Courington is a Project Engineer where he works to help clients in Industrial Maintenance/IT, EH&S and Quality by instruction and engineering services, he also helps co-workers transporting the instrumentation, DCS or Mechanical MTU’s.
In 10 years with ATN, Larry E. Courington has a total of 43 years of experience in maintenance & repair. Larry is also a U.S. Navy veteran, Nuclear Trained Machinist Mate/ELT, Submarine Service qualified.
Prior to joining ATN, Larry was the Maintenance, Engineering & Reliability Manager for a major cast iron pipe company and responsible for all maintenance, budgeting, parts inventory, labor costs, and supervision of front line supervisors and hourly workers. While there, he achieved greater uptime and stayed within the maintenance budget by listening to his workers and working with them to maintain all aspects of the plant and increase maintenance worker moral.
Larry E. Courington is certified in the following:         
Yaskawa DX100 Basic Programming with Arc Welding
General Industry OSHA outreach trainer
CDL, Class A, with Double, Triple & Tanker endorsements
Mobile Crane Certified Trainer & Operator
Telescoping Boom [<21 Ton, 21-75 Ton, >75 Ton]
Lattice Boom Carrier, Lattice Boom Crawler
Service Mechanic Truck, Articulating Boom Crane
A graduate from The University of Alabama, Larry holds a degree in Electrical Engineering. In the summer of 2020, Larry finishes his Master’s degree in Education, Learning, and Technology. When not hard at work, he enjoys being on the softball field, the paintball field, and training for a Spartan race.

Name: Jeff Palmer
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Jeffrey Palmer is a Project Engineer located at the Montgomery Office, where he works to Provide Training and Technical Support in the area of Lean Manufacturing as well as Industrial Maintenance.  
In 11 years with ATN and among various projects, Jeff has been providing valuable apprenticeship training for a large Stainless-Steel manufacturer.  This program – approved and supported by the US Department of Labor, involves providing mechanical training for selected Operations Team Members as they transition into Industrial Maintenance roles.  
Prior to joining ATN, Jeff has 10 years’ experience as a Manufacturing Engineer with various companies, with his most recent experience as the Maintenance Manager for Halla Climate Systems Alabama where he was responsible for equipment and facilities management for the total facility. While there, he improved equipment availability by 20% through the identification and procurement of critical spare parts and improving manning within the Maintenance Department.  Prior to his experience in manufacturing in the private sector, Jeff retired after 20 years with the US Air Force where he served as an Aircraft Maintenance Technician and a Civil Engineering Officer.
A graduate from the University of Illinois, Jeff holds a BS and MS in Industrial Engineering. When not at work, Jeff enjoys competitive shooting.

Name: Jeff Lankford
Title: Center Director
Bio:
Jeff Lankford is the Center Director in Gadsden where he works to assist companies by providing training and assistance in the areas of Industrial Maintenance and Lean Manufacturing.
In addition to over 20 years with ATN, Lankford also has 8 years of manufacturing experience.
Prior to joining ATN, Jeff was a Project Engineer at United States Steel, Fairfield Tubular Operations, where he was responsible for projects.  Before US Steel, Jeff was an Electrical Engineer in the Plate Products Division for Gulf States Steel and was responsible for electrical maintenance and projects for that division.
Jeff has been certified in the following:         
AME Lean Bronze Certification
A graduate of Auburn University, Jeff holds a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering. When not hard at work for ATN, he enjoys spending time with his family.

Name: Jeff Graham
Title: Center Director
Bio:
Jeff Graham is a Center Director for the following ATN locations: Alex City, Eufaula, and Montgomery. Jeff works to assist manufacturers across the state by providing delivery and management of projects that promote continual improvement through training programs and technical assistance services.
In 15 years with ATN, Graham has managed multiple centers, delivered LEAN, Leadership and Excel training, assisted with Kaizens, and been involved in local, state, and federal programs that help manufacturers to improve their business.
Prior to joining ATN, Jeff was the Engineering Supervisor for Russell Corporation and responsible for crewing analysis, machine requirements, operation procedures, and weekly product scheduling. While there, he achieved GS&D certification.
Graham is certified in the following:         
GSD (General Sew & Design)
Alabama Workforce Development Professional
LEAN Bronze SME
TM 309 Mastering the Front of the Room
TM 209 Focus on the Front of the Room
Innovation Engineering Leadership Institute
SC 101 RFID Basics Workshop
LE101 Principals of Lean Manufacturing with Live Simulation
SC 401 Introduction to RFID with Simulation Train the Trainer Workshop
A graduate from Auburn University, Graham holds a degree in TMT from the School of Engineering. When not at work helping ATN clients, he enjoys playing music and fishing.

Name: Jared Choat
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Jared Choat is an EHS Project Engineer where he works to improve environmental, health, and safety outcomes and compliance by delivering training, technical services, and conducting audits.
With his first year at ATN, Choat has a total of 10 years of experience and adds diversity as an industrial hygienist to provide additional elements of occupational health and safety training and technical services for ATN.
Prior to joining ATN, Jared was a Senior Industrial Hygienist for Alabama Power and responsible for health and safety training, programs, and risk assessments. While there, he impacted many projects as a subject matter expert and implementing risk controls.
Jared is certified in the following:     
Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH)
Certified Safety Professional (CSP)
Jared graduated from the University of North Alabama with a Bachelor of Science in Chemistry and Industrial Hygiene, and a Master of Business Administration. Jared is also a graduate from the University of Alabama at Birmingham where he earned a Master of Public Health focusing in Environmental Health Sciences. When not hard at work, he enjoys spending time with family, playing music, and golf.

Name: Jada Freeman
Title: MEP Program Coordinator
Bio:
Jada Freeman is the MEP Program Coordinator where she is responsible for assisting the ATN Director of MEP Program with all National Institute of Standards and Technology Manufacturing Extension Partnership (NIST MEP) reporting and compliance functions within ATN.  She has worked with ATN for over 13 years.
A graduate from Athens State University, Jada holds a degree in Management. When not hard at work doing NIST MEP activities, she enjoys spending time with her family.

Name: James Hammonds
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
James Hammonds is a Project Engineer located in Gadsden where he works to assist companies by providing training and assistance in the area of Industrial Maintenance.
In addition to my 5 years with ATN, Hammonds has 30 years of manufacturing experience.
Prior to joining ATN, James was a Maintenance Manager, Technician, and Instructor in the steel industry and responsible for training and managing technicians. As a technician, he was responsible for maintaining equipment for daily operation.
A graduate from DeVry Institute of Technology, James holds a bachelor’s degree in Electronic Engineering Technology. When not hard at work for ATN, he enjoys spending time with his family.

Name: Gina Webb
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Gina Webb is a Project Engineer, where she travels the great state of Alabama providing training and consulting services to existing business and industry.
In 11.5 years with ATN, Webb has 23 years of experience in business and industry.  She specializes in Industrial Maintenance and Information Technology.
Prior to joining ATN, Gina was a Plant Engineer for 3M Company and was responsible for maintenance and troubleshooting for the Guin plant. She also has also worked as a database programmer and C/C++ programmer for Southern Company Services.
A graduate from The University of Alabama in Birmingham, Gina holds a master’s degree in Information and Engineering Management and a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa.  When not hard at work, she enjoys spending time with her family.

Name: Ed Steapleton
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Ed Steapleton is a Project Engineer where he works to train machinist, both manual and CNC as operators, setup persons, and programmers.
In 22 with ATN, Ed Steapleton has 50 years of experience.  In 1999 received SME certification of Manufacturing Technologist and has received metalworking skills certification skills through NIMS.
Prior to joining ATN, Ed was a Project Engineer for Rainbow Tool and Machine and responsible for purchasing materials, job tracking, and creating operation manuals for special machines.
Ed has the following certifications:
Measurement, Materials, & Safety
CNC Milling Skills Level II
Ed is a graduate of Jacksonville State University and Gadsden State Community College, where he has a degree in Computer Integrated Manufacturing and Computer Science and Electronic Engineering.

Name: Doug Blackmon
Title: IT Technology Specialist
Bio:
Doug Blackmon is an IT Technology Specialist located in Eufaula, where he works to support ATN and their internal network infrastructure.
In 15 years with ATN, Blackmon has leveraged his 38 years of experience by designing, implementing, and supporting IT solutions. Blackmon also assisted with the State Park system to design a fiber and wireless network system, allowing the park system to migrate to a more efficient software system and give guest WIFI internet in some of the most remote places in Alabama.
Prior to joining ATN, Doug Blackmon was the Electrical Systems Engineer for Aero Products and responsible for the design of emergency vehicle electrical systems. While there, he managed to change the way the company designed and manufactured emergency vehicles in several areas, allowing the company to enhance the reliability of key electrical systems and save substantially on manufacturing costs.
Doug Blackmon is certified in the following:        
ETA International Fiber Optic Certification
3CX VoIP PBX Certification
Canon-certified on Analog and Digital systems
Microsoft MTA
When not working, he enjoys being part of a professional race team, competing in the NASCAR ARCA series as a spotter.

Name: Cynthia Walker
Title: Office Manager
Bio:
Cynthia Walker is an Office Manager where she works for the Eufaula, Montgomery, and Enterprise centers for field staff employees and assists with the Internal IT department in Eufaula.
In 2011, Walker joined ATN and she has 30 years of working experience in her field of study.  Also, she has had much experience in reception, payroll/accounting, computer skills, and serving her customers to the best of her ability.
Prior to joining ATN, Walker was the Receptionist for Wallace Community College in Eufaula, Alabama, and responsible for all switchboard calls, internal communication, and other receptionist duties. While there, she achieved experience communicating and dealing with the employees, students, and the general public.  Walker served 11 years in this capacity.
A graduate from Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College in Tifton, Georgia, Walker holds an AAS degree in General Business. When not hard at work doing office manager duties, she enjoys spending time with her family.

Name: Chris Anderson
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Chris Anderson is a Project Engineer where he works to better businesses in Alabama by Continuous Improvement training and Quality training/implementation.
In 14 years with ATN, Anderson has implemented ISO-based management systems for many different companies, with expertise in environmental, safety, and quality, including the Automotive (IATF) and Aerospace (AS) standards.  In addition, he trains on both Continuous Improvement (Lean) offerings and quality engineering training, such as the automotive core tools.   He currently serves as the Co-leader of the statewide Continuous Improvement (CI) Team for ATN.
Prior to joining ATN, Anderson was a product line engineer, industrial engineer, and production supervisor for both automotive and non-automotive companies for 12 years, where he implemented lean and audited the employers’ quality management systems.
Anderson is certified in the following:
AME/SME Lean Bronze Certified (and previous certification judge)
NIST Certified Lean Practitioner
ASQ Certified Quality Auditor
ASQ Certified Green Belt
A graduate from Auburn University, Anderson holds a degree in Industrial and Systems Engineering. When not hard at work helping companies improve, he enjoys fishing, sports, and spending time with his wife and 3 kids.

Name: Tim Hickman
Title: LMD Training Facilitator
Bio:
Tim Hickman is a Leadership and Management Development Training Facilitator at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he works to develop and conduct training and technical assistance activities for business and industry in the area of leadership and management development.

Tim has 26 years of experience in Human resource management and leadership development in the aviation and automobile industry. Tim also ran the international leadership development program for GKN Aerospace based in the UK.

Prior to joining ATN, Tim was the vice president of human resources for Wellborn Forest products and was responsible for all facets of HR, employee relations, training, and environmental health and safety. A graduate of Auburn University, Montgomery Tim obtained a degree in business administration.

When not at work, he enjoys hanging out with his family and anything to do with fast cars and boats. Tim is married to his beautiful wife, Staci, of 25 years and has two boys, Dylan (21) and Alex (18).

Name: Camie Huett
Title: Admin. Assistant to the Executive Director
Bio:
Camie Huett serves as the Administrative Assistant to the Executive Director, where she brings over 20 years of administrative experience to the table with expertise in scheduling, planning, and correspondence.
In the 15 years with ATN, Camie has become an asset in data management and project coordination. Camie has a total of 27 years with the Alabama Community College System. Camie also serves on the Alabama Community College Association Executive Committee for 20+ years; most recently serving as the Registration Coordinator and Auxiliaries Coordinator.
In addition, Huett represents ATN in the Birmingham Chapter of Executive Women International, where she has held numerous board positions and serving on various committees.
Prior to joining ATN, Camie was the Administrative Assistant to the President for Bessemer State Technical College.
Certifications
Certified Professional Secretary (CPS)
Certified Public Notary
A graduate from Jefferson State Community College, Camie holds a degree in Business/Office Information Processing. When not hard at work, she enjoys spending time with family and Alabama football.

Name: Ashley Lackey
Title: Office Manager
Bio:
Ashley Lackey is the Office Manager in Cullman, where she provides assistance and support to the Cullman Center. Ashley is the backbone of the day to day operations, including purchasing, time reconciliations, contracts, and invoicing.
In 14 years with ATN, Lackey has developed a close relationship with the community by volunteering with the Cullman Area Chamber of Commerce and the Decatur-Morgan County Chamber of Commerce.  Lackey has a passion for her position and has mastered meeting the needs of clients to help grow the workforce community.  
Before joining ATN, Ashley was a Facilitator for the North Alabama Skills Training Consortium and was responsible for assisting clients with creating resumes for client job search. She also counseled clients with career planning and educational options available.  
A graduate from Auburn University, Ashley holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in English, specialization in Technical Writing. When not hard at work, she enjoys spending time with her four kids and her husband of 14 years.

Name: Becky Estes
Title: Business Manager
Bio:
Becky Estes serves as the Business Manager, where she works to support ATN staff by processing payroll, accounts payable, and human resources.
In over thirteen years with ATN, Estes worked as Center Office Manager prior to moving to Central Office Business Manager in October 2018.  She won the MEP National Unsung Hero award in 2010, an achievement made possible by going above and beyond to promote ATN in client, stakeholder, and staff relations.
Prior to joining ATN, Becky was the Assistant Manager and Loan Officer for Colonial Bank, responsible for daily branch operations and loans. While there, she achieved sales goals by relating to her customers and helping them achieve their financial goals.
A graduate of the University of North Alabama, Becky holds a degree in Business Management. When not hard at work doing accounts payable, payroll, and human resources duties, she enjoys traveling and reading.

Name: Brandon Lineberry
Title: Project Manager
Bio:
Brandon Lineberry serves as a Project Engineer where he specializes in Continuous Improvement training and implementation.
In 16 years at ATN, he has trained hundreds of executives, managers, engineers, and operators on the Principles of Lean Manufacturing.  He has facilitated over a hundred Kaizen Events in various industries including, chemical, paper, automotive, aerospace, foundry, shipbuilding, steel, textile, assembly, and office.
Brandon has a B.S. in Chemical Engineering, certified NIST Lean Trainer, SME Lean Bronze, and Six Sigma Green Belt.  He served as ATN’s Lean Team Leader for six years and received ATN Practitioner of the Year awards in 2006 and 2012.
When not serving clients, Brandon enjoys spending time in God’s great outdoors on the water and in the woods.

Name: Brooke Waldrop
Title: Office Manager
Bio:
Brooke Waldrop is the Office Manager for the Sumiton center where she efficiently manages the daily operations of the center which include accounts payable and receivable, maintaining ATN policies and procedures, inventory management, maintaining relationships with clients and the community, clerical support, record keeping and database management. She also provides support to the directors and field staff by monitoring and assisting with preparation for project work.
Including her five years with ATN, Waldrop has a total of ten years of office administrative experience. In her previous role in the healthcare field, Waldrop developed her strong customer service, communication and organizational skills.
A graduate from the University of North Alabama, Brooke holds a bachelor’s degree in business administration with a major in Marketing. When not hard at work, she enjoys reading, fishing, spending time with family and raising her two beautiful little girls.

Name: Whitney Barlow
Title: Supplier Development Manager
Bio:
Whitney Barlow serves as the Supplier Development Manager at the Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where she plays a key role in strengthening Alabama’s supply chain by connecting manufacturers with critical resources, training, and growth opportunities. She works closely with businesses and ATN partners across the state to enhance supplier capabilities, improve operational efficiency, and support industry expansion.
With extensive experience in business development, manufacturing support, and workforce training, Whitney specializes in helping companies optimize operations and establish strategic partnerships. She is passionate about fostering economic growth and ensuring Alabama’s manufacturers remain competitive in an evolving market.
Before joining ATN, Whitney served as the Executive Director of the Industrial Development Authority of Chilton County, focusing on industry engagement and supplier relations. Her leadership in economic development equipped her with the expertise to help businesses navigate challenges and seize new opportunities.
Beyond her professional role, Whitney is actively involved in community and industry organizations. She serves on the Board of Directors for the Alabama Outdoor Ethics and Education Partnership, CAWCO R C & D, the City of Thorsby Chilton County Strawberry Festival Committee, and Outdoor Women Unlimited, Inc.
Whitney is married to Ben Barlow, and they share three children: Addison, Easton, and Stella. She enjoys spending time with her family, traveling, and embracing the outdoors—whether it’s hunting, kayaking, shooting sports, or archery. Her favorite outdoor pursuit is bird hunting, especially turkey hunting.

Name: Perry Shields
Title: Center Director
Bio:
Perry Shields serves as the Center Director for the Cullman and Hanceville locations where he works to assist Alabama Manufactures by finding the needs of companies and connecting them with ATN resources.
Including the 14 years with ATN, Shields has 27 total years of manufacturing experience. Shields is a Certified Maintenance Manager, an achievement made possible by the years of experience he has in Industrial Maintenance Management.
Prior to joining ATN, Shields was the Maintenance Superintendent for Union Foundry, A McWayne Company, and was responsible for Plant efficiency maintenance.
Perry Shields is certified in the following:         
Certified Maintenance Management
A graduate from Jacksonville State & Gadsden State, Shields holds a degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering. When not hard at work, Shields enjoys hunting & fishing.

Name: Sandy Lee
Title: Office Manager
Bio:
Sandy Lee is the Office Manager for the Mobile and Thomasville centers, where she engages her management skills to work closely with the center directors and field staff.  She is responsible for the day to day operations including procurement, invoicing, and quality control while providing administrative support for center employees.  
For over 12 years with ATN, Lee has been dedicated to ATN and its mission of helping Alabama develop a highly skilled and trained workforce.  Lee serves on several internal committees, facilitating ATN’s continuous improvement.
Sandy came to ATN with a vast array of knowledge, experience, and skills obtained through many years of prior employment in diverse industries.   
Sandy holds a BS degree in Management of Technology, where she graduated Summa Cum Laude from Athens State University. She also holds two Associate degrees from Coastal Alabama Community College (formally Faulkner State Community College).  When not at work, she enjoys spending time with family and friends.

Name: Sheri Compton
Title: Project Manager
Bio:
Sheri Compton is a Project Manager who works to manage and develop Industrial Maintenance/IT/EHS and Engineering Service Projects working with clients relative to the Electrical/ Instrumentation and Mechanical Workforce. Sheri works to increase manufacturing employees' technical skill levels by developing, implementing, and providing quality training programs in areas requested and needed by manufacturing industries throughout the State of Alabama.
Including 15 years with ATN, Sheri has over thirty years of experience in Electrical and Instrumentation Maintenance, engineering, and repair.
Before joining ATN, Sheri was the electrical engineer for ESAB welding and cutting and was responsible for designing and implementing new projects for cutting machine product lines. While there, she achieved a $250K cost reduction across the SABRE, Avenger, and Silhouette product lines and implemented a new low-cost I/O system on the SABRE product lines. 
Sheri Compton is certified in the following:     
NCCER Training (The National Center for Construction Education and Research)
MSSC Training (Manufacturing Skills Standard Council)
Allen Bradley PLC 5, SLC 500, ControlLogix Training
Siemens Simatic Step 7 Training
TriNova Instrumentation Training
A graduate from Auburn University, Sheri holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering. When not hard at work, Sheri enjoys spending time with her three children, Shoni (age 21), Shaelin (age 20), and Shon Kristopher (age 16).  Sheri also enjoys cooking, baking, fishing and hunting and spending time in her garden.  She is also a member of the Demopolis Kiwanis Club and Fairhaven Baptist Church.

Name: Brad James
Title: Center Director
Bio:
Brad James is a Center Director with the Alabama Technology Network at Coastal Alabama Community College in Thomasville. He has worked with continuous and Discrete industries for over 18 years with ATN, working in all aspects of the process, including operations management.

Brad has over 30 years manufacturing and industry experience and has led Lean Kaizen and delivered Lean manufacturing training. He has developed and implemented Lean for continuous industries. He is also trained in the Six Sigma Black Belt.

Prior to joining ATN, Brad held various positions in the Pulp, Paper, and Chemicals industry responsible for Operations Management and Process Improvement. While there, he achieved process improvement and production increases by implementing Lean principles and other operational improvements.

Brad is certified in the following:
• NIST certified Lean trainer and Implementer

A graduate of the University of Alabama, Brad holds a degree in Chemical Engineering. When not hard at work, he enjoys hunting and fishing.

Name: Amanda Rials
Title: Food Industry Project Engineer
Bio:
Amanda Rials is a Project Engineer where she works to develop and administer training as well as provide technical assistance to food and food allied manufacturing organizations.
Rials has over 20 years of experience in food safety and quality while working in the food industry.
Prior to joining ATN, Rials was the Senior Manager in Food Safety Quality Assurance for Tyson Foods, Inc. and responsible for Supplier Management. While there, she gained knowledge and experience developing and managing food safety and quality operations in both USDA and FDA facilities.
Amanda Rials is certified in the following:         
International HACCP Alliance HACCP Certification
American Society of Quality Certified Quality Auditor
FSPCA Preventive Controls Qualified Individual for Human Food
FSPCA Preventive Controls Qualified Individual for Animal Food
A graduate from Auburn University, Amanda Rials holds a degree in Poultry Science with a minor in Agribusiness. When not hard at work keeping the food supply chain safe, she enjoys riding her bike and volunteering with the Junior League and being an active board member at Turpentine Creek Wildlife Refuge, one of the largest big cat sanctuaries in the U.S.

Name: Bruce Perdue
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Bruce Perdue is a Project Engineer, where he provides environmental/health/safety services and training to assist manufacturers to comply with regulatory obligations.
With over ten years with ATN, Bruce has almost 30 years of experience in researching and solving EHS problems for employers and clients.  
Prior to joining ATN, Bruce was an Environmental Engineer with the consulting firm of TTL in Tuscaloosa.  As a consultant and as an ATN Engineer, he has done EHS work in a wide variety of fields: transportation, petroleum refining, electricity generation, and distribution, chemicals, electronics, and iron foundries.  
Bruce is a Certified Hazardous Materials Manager (CHMM).  
A graduate from Auburn University, Bruce holds a degree in Physics. When not hard at work for ATN, he enjoys sailing and “pioneer craft” such as making soap and beer, hunting, and fishing.

Name: LaVada Varner
Title: Center Director
Bio:
LaVada Varner is a Center Director serving both Birmingham and Sumiton centers. LaVada collaborates and grows partnerships with stakeholders in business and industries throughout Central Six Regional Workforce Council (Region 4) and West Alabama Workforce Regional Workforce Council (Region 3).
LaVada has over 36 years of experience in the automotive and manufacturing industry which includes 14 years with ATN, where she has served as Project Engineer for the first six years and Center Director for the last eight years. During her time with ATN, she has worked with manufacturers throughout Alabama in coaching, training, implementing, & auditing for lean transformations and quality management systems as well as marketing, partnership, & business development. LaVada has served in numerous roles for key projects/organizations throughout Alabama.
Prior to joining ATN, LaVada held various leadership roles with General Motors which included assignments at five different divisions. While there, she achieved progressive positions from engineering to the leadership of workstations up to General Motors Global Management System.
A graduate from the University of Alabama, LaVada holds a B.S. in Industrial Engineering and an MBA in Global Management from the University of Phoenix. She holds certifications in Six Sigma Black Belt, Integrity Coaching, and numerous lean manufacturing and quality management systems. When not hard at work, LaVada enjoys movies, sports, and spending time with her family.

Name: Mike Pierce
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Mike Pierce, Project Engineer - Leadership & Management Development located in Cullman, is a proven leader with experience in program management, business development, manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, and more.
Mike has more than 35 years of operational leadership, strategic and operational planning, mergers and acquisitions, program/project management, engineering, quality assurance supply chain, maintenance, and facilities across diverse industries including the aerospace market segment. His primary focus at ATN is operational improvements, quality audits, business management system implementation to standards like ISO 9001, AS 9100, ISO 17025, and others. He also offers cross-functional leadership training, Kaizen facilitation, and other manufacturing/quality-related training.
Before coming aboard ATN, Pierce served as the Senior Program Manager/Operations for General Dynamics Global Imaging Technologies where he led implementation team for the sites first fully integrated optical assembly; the LN-120 GPS Astro-tracker, shipping to performance requirements on time and to budget, producing $5M in annual sales. Accountability included all aspects of the product's life cycle from first sales contact to the proposal, negotiation, contractual agreement, SOW, design, manufacture, quality, cost, and delivery.
Mike has a Bachelor of Business Administration in Technical Business from Athens State University. In addition, he received his associate degree in Engineering from Wallace State Community College.

Name: Robert Denton
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Robert Denton is a Project Engineer, where he works to help manufacturers with instrumentation and controls training and problem-solving.
Including three years with ATN, Denton has thirty-seven years in industry and education. His primary knowledge and skills are based in the industrial maintenance world.  They include Programmable Logic Controllers, Instrumentation, Electrical Safety, pneumatics, hydraulics, and maintenance management strategies.  
Prior to joining ATN, Denton was the Instrumentation and Controls Instructor for Alabama Southern Community College and responsible for developing the Electrical and Instrumentation Program. While there, the program, which started with six students, increased to over fifty students enrolling per semester.   
A graduate from Athens State University, Denton holds a degree in Post-Secondary Technical Education. When not hard at work, he enjoys camping and sailing.  Denton also holds an Associate in Applied Science from Hobson State Technical College and an Associate of Science from Alabama Southern Community College.

Name: Robert Tomlinson
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Robert Tomlinson serves as Project Engineer where he develops and implements a variety of Environmental, Safety, and Health training and technical assistance programs including OSHA, EPA, DOT, and ISO management systems to a wide variety of clients.
Including 20 years with ATN, Robert has over 30 years of ES&H experience and also provides hands-on, hazard recognition workshops, an achievement made possible by his work in hazardous waste operations and emergency response.
Prior to joining ATN, Robert was the Operations Manager at a manufacturing facility, an Environmental Consultant, and Geologist in Greensboro, North Carolina.

Robert is a Certified in the following:
Hazardous Materials Manager
OSHA Authorized General Industry Trainer
OSHA Authorized Construction Trainer
OSHA Authorized Disaster Site Worker Trainer
Authorized Instructor of the Community & College Consortium for Health & Safety Training
Innovation Engineering Black Belt
A graduate from Guilford College, and additional instruction at Oklahoma State University, Robert holds a degree in Geology with an Environmental, Safety, and Health concentration. When not at work, Robert enjoys bicycling, volunteering, and serving on an annual medical mission trip.

Name: Ronny Kisor
Title: Center Director
Bio:
Ronny Kisor is the Center Director of Rainsville and Muscle Shoals locations. He is also a management rep for ATN’s ISO 9001 certification. Ronny has been with Alabama Technology Network for over 25 years and has over 30 years of experience in manufacturing.
Prior to joining ATN, Ronny worked in the machining, welding, NDT, and metalworking industry in Quality Engineering and Quality Management.
Kisor is certified in the following:         
ASQ- Certified Quality Engineer
ASQ- Certified Quality Auditor
SSBB- Six Sigma Black Belt
A graduate from the University of Alabama, Ronny holds an MS degree in Engineering and a BS degree in Nondestructive Testing from Athens State University. When not hard at work, he enjoys his grandkids, working with his homemade sawmill, and old muscle cars.

Name: Tim Croley
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Tim Croley is a Project Engineer that works to provide training and technical assistance services for both hourly and management level personnel across all industries throughout the state, by researching company needs and working to customize solutions to meet those unique needs.
In seven years with ATN, Croley has a combined 14 years of experience in the Safety, Health, and Environmental profession. He has also obtained status as a Certified Safety Professional, an achievement made possible by a dedication to the profession and continuous education of regulations, standards, and best practices.  
Prior to joining ATN, Tim was the Safety and Environmental Manager for Coastal Forest Products and responsible for the safety and environmental compliance, site security, risk management, managing various systems and programs, and ensuring all employees received required training. While there, he achieved a 35% recordable incident reduction by establishing site safety committees for all operations and working to educate and empower committee members to eliminate hazards and control risks.  
Tim is certified in the following:
Certified Safety Professional (CSP, Board of Certified Safety Professionals, 2016)
OSHA OTI Authorized General Industry Trainer (Georgia Tech, 2018)
Certified Crane Operator and Instructor through CIC/CIA (Crane Institute Certification/Crane Institute of America, November 2019)
ISO 14001:2015 Lead Auditor Certification (AQS Management Systems, Inc., 2015)
HAZWOPER Instructor through the Hazardous Material Training & Research Institute (HMTRI, updated 2018)
HAZMAT DOT Train-the-Trainer (Sustainable Workplace Alliance, 2014)
Six Sigma Green Belt (Alabama Technology Network, November 2019)
A graduate from Columbia Southern University, Tim holds a Master of Science Degree in Occupational Health & Safety. When not hard at work, he enjoys spending time with his family as they travel, attend various sporting events, participate in sporting events, fish together, and work to serve others in their local community.

Name: Tanesha Richburg
Title: NetSuite Administrator
Bio:
Tanesha Richburg serves as the NetSuite Administrator where she manages and maintains ATN's NetSuite ERP system and works with various business areas such as operations, purchasing, finance, and NIST/MEP regulations. Tanesha is responsible for all aspects of NetSuite including implementation, upgrades, updates, configuration, coordination, control, maintenance, troubleshooting, security, usage, monitoring, and development.
Prior to joining ATN, Tanesha Richburg was an Accounts Examiner for Examiners of Public Accounts and responsible for auditing state entities.
A graduate from Troy University, Tanesha Richburg holds a master’s degree in Business Administration with an emphasis in Accounting. When not hard at work doing administration, she enjoys reading and spending time with her family.

Name: Ronnie Daniels
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Ronnie is an EHS Project Engineer serving the Montgomery area. A native of Montgomery, Ronnie graduated from Auburn University Montgomery in 1991 with a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration.  Ronnie began his career as a workers’ compensation claims adjuster where he investigated workplace accidents and paid loss time accident claims.  Later, he transferred to the safety field and has worked as an Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) professional for over 25 years. Ronnie has experience in both the public and private sectors and has extensive EHS experience in a manufacturing setting.
Ronnie is certified in the following:
Certified Safety Professional (CSP, Board of Certified Safety Professionals)
OSHA OTI Authorized General Industry Trainer
Licensed Grade II Water Operator (Alabama Department of Environmental Management)
Before coming on board with ATN, Ronnie worked for the Department of Finance, Division of Risk Management where he assisted state agencies with workplace safety.

Name: Grace Trevino
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Grace Trevino is a Project Engineer – Quality Engineering/System where she develops and conducts training and technical assistance activities for business and industry.
Trevino has more than 25 years of industry experience.  She has worked as an Advanced Quality Engineer, Project Engineer, Engineering Manager, and Plant Manager in various industries including automotive, appliance, and military packaging.  She credits these achievements to great mentors, a desire to continue learning, and a belief in collaborative work environments.
Prior to joining ATN, Grace was the Project Engineer and Quality Manager for Hyco Alabama and was responsible for leading new hydraulic cylinders projects. New projects included a service and repair center, a rebuild to the chrome processing shop, and several new cylinder design implementations.
A graduate from Calvin College, Grace holds a degree in Mechanical Engineering.  She then continued her education from Western Michigan University, with classes in Engineering Management. When not hard at work she enjoys traveling, fishing, and working with young people.

Name: Jimmy Marley
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Jimmy Marley is a Project Engineer – Quality Engineering/Systems at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he works to Improve Client’s quality performance by developing, managing, and implementing technical assistance and training projects in the areas of Quality Engineering and Quality Systems.
Prior to joining ATN, Jimmy was the Sr. Quality Engineer for SL Alabama and Quality Engineer for Briggs & Stratton. Responsibilities include: Overseeing the Reliability Test Lab, Teaching and Mentoring Green Belts as a Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt Train the Trainer, Teaching SPC, and Leading Warranty Reduction/Continuous Improvement Projects. While there, he achieved the ability to help others develop an understanding of continuous improvement by applying the concepts he learned through leading projects and teaching Lean Six Sigma to other employees.
Jimmy is certified in the following:                
Lean Six Sigma Black Belt – Air Academy Associates, Colorado Springs, CO
A graduate from Auburn University, Jimmy holds a degree in Materials Engineering. When not hard at work doing Project Engineer – Quality Engineering/Systems, he enjoys running, fishing, refereeing soccer, and supporting L.F.C.

Name: Phil Kelly
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
Phillip A. Kelly is a Project Engineer where he works to educate and empower Alabama’s workforce by providing instruction on industrial maintenance technology, theory, application, and best practices.
Including 8 years with Georgia Pacific, 13 years with Boise Paper, and 3 plus years with ATN, Mr. Kelly has 40 total years of industrial experience.  He is the co-author of five publications.  He is a Member (Emeritus) of Couch Pit University, an organization, consisting of 100 expert North American papermakers, and paper engineers, that exists to advance the pulp and paper industry and assist young papermakers. 
Prior to joining ATN, Phil was a Senior Process Technology Engineer and most recently Technical Capability Leader for Georgia Pacific Corporation, where he was responsible for productivity improvement and education of the Georgia Pacific Container and Packaging Group workforce.
A graduate from The Institute of Paper Science and Technology, a school of Georgia Institute of Technology, Phil holds an MS degree with an area of concentration in Chemical Engineering.  He earned his BS at Charleston Southern University.  When not hard at work, Phil enjoys time with his family, music, and Southwest Alabama country living.

Name: Dean Gahr
Title: Project Engineer - EHS
Bio:
Project Engineer - Environmental, Health, and Safety at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where Dean works to develop and conduct training and technical assistance activities for business and industry, particularly in the area of Environmental Health and Safety.
Dean has twenty years of experience of which, 10 years are in the Oil & Gas Industry and 10 years, are in the consulting of State, Municipal, and Industry in the fields of Emergency Response and, Environmental, Health and Safety Compliance. Within the last 14 years, he has held HSE Positions, both in the Continental US and Overseas.
Throughout his career, Dean has developed expertise in Industrial Safety Standards, OSHA Regulations, including the development of many Safety Management Systems, Training Programs, Emergency Response, Risk Management, and (ISO 14000, 14001, 9001) Program Assessments.
Prior to joining ATN, Dean was the HSE Coordinator for REHAU Automotive and responsible for the Health, Safety, and Environmental Management for the Cullman, Alabama Facility. While there, he was able to reduce their Total Recordable Incident Rate below the Industry average, through the revision and implementation of new training programs, and enhanced Heath and Safety Case Management, including international HSE Auditing of REHEA Facilities outside the United States, primarily the European Union.
Dean is certified in the following:     
CIHM (Certified Industrial Hygiene Management)
COSH (Occupational Safety and Health Management Systems)
CSM (Certified Safety Manager) (NASP)
ISO 14001-45001 Lead Auditor (TUV-Germany)         
A graduate from Columbia Southern University, Dean holds a degree in Occupational Safety and Health. When not at work, he enjoys spending time with his family, animals and working on Import Cars.

Name: Matthew Weitz
Title: Project Engineer - Aviation
Bio:
Matthew Weitz is the Aviation/Continuous Improvement Project Engineer, at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he works to assist Alabama manufacturers improve their processing using continuous improvement tools.
In addition to his time with ATN, Matthew has 18 years of experience in aviation and aerospace integration for special projects. Matthew served multiple years as a Senior Program Management Team Lead, 2 years as a Project Planner, surveyed countless aircraft for retrofits, and acted as a consultant/ liaison engineer to several major airlines. These achievements were made possible through Matthew’s dedication, communication, leadership skills and attention to detail.
Prior to joining ATN, Matthew was the Senior Project Planner for Airbus Space and Defense and was responsible for the schedules and coordination of plans for the Maintenance Repair Organization. Prior to his time with Airbus he worked for 15 years with Star Aviation (later Carlisle Interconnect Technologies) as the Project Management Lead, where he worked closely with upper management, manufacturing, and engineering to ensure all levels of program success for the integration of various aircraft systems and upgrades.
Matthew is certified as a Project Management Professional (PMP).
A graduate from Purdue University, Matthew holds a Master's degree in Industrial Technology and a Bachelor’s degree in Aviation Administration Technology. When not at work he enjoys spending time with his wife and three amazing children, camping, wood working, home improvement projects, and tinkering with automobiles.

Name: Natasha Parker
Title: Accounts Payable and Payroll Specialist
Bio:
Natasha Parker is the Accounts Payable & Payroll Specialist at ATN, where she performs payroll, accounts payable, in addition to other accounting and bookkeeping functions. 
Natasha has 16 years of experience in the Finance Industry and brings a wealth of expertise to her role. Her multifaceted background also includes human resources, proposal management, and project management, showcasing her aptitude, adaptability, and analytical skills. 
Prior to joining ATN, Natasha served as the Benefits & Payroll Specialist at Trenholm State Community College. In this capacity, she successfully managed payroll and employee benefits, oversaw fixed assets, and contributed to various accounting functions, further enhancing her professional skill set. 
Natasha holds a Bachelor of Science in Business and a Master of Science in Management, both from Faulkner University. Outside of her professional endeavors, she enjoys traveling, exploring culinary delights, and spending quality time with her husband, Derrick.

Name: Essence Drake
Title: Program Development Associate
Bio:
Essence Drake serves as the Program Development Associate at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where she works to drive market penetration, strengthen partnerships, and contribute to the growth and success of Alabama’s manufacturing community.

Essence has over 20 years of combined work experience in the public and private sectors. Prior to joining ATN, Essence developed customer service and relationship management, public administration, and program management skills across multiple industries, including construction/private sector, non-profit/education, state government, retail, and banking. Essence’s strengths are her interpersonal relations skills, positive attitude, and excitement for learning.

A graduate of West Virginia University and Alabama State University, Essence holds an M.S. degree in Integrated Marketing Communications and a B.S. degree in Business Administration, respectively. When not at work, she enjoys reading and spending quality time with loved ones.

Name: Sarah Carter
Title: Business Development Manager
Bio:
Sarah Carter serves as the Business Relations Manager at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where she builds and strengthens relationships with prospective and existing manufacturing and industrial clients while promoting ATN’s services across Alabama.
With a decade of experience connecting businesses to resources that enhance profitability and upskill their workforce, Sarah has played a key role in supporting Alabama's industries. Over the past four years, she has helped more than 30 companies in Central Alabama access a federal grant, which provided over $3 million in reimbursement to train both new and existing employees.
Prior to joining ATN, Sarah worked as the Regional Workforce Council Liaison to Central AlabamaWorks and Assistant Manager for the Regional Workforce Council Division of the Alabama Department of Commerce. In these roles, she connected businesses with vital state, regional, and local resources to address workforce development needs. She collaborated with key stakeholders such as Alabama Career Centers, chambers of commerce, economic developers, educators, and elected officials to identify workforce challenges, develop solutions, and guide companies on funding opportunities.
Sarah holds a degree in Business Administration from Auburn University Montgomery and has completed several prestigious programs, including Auburn University’s Government and Economic Intensive Course, the Delta Regional Authority’s Leadership Institute, and the Blaze Performance Executive Leadership Academy. She also holds the Alabama Talent Developer Certification from the Governor’s Office of Education and Workforce Transformation.
Actively involved in her community, Sarah contributes her time to the Prattville Chamber of Commerce, the Prattville YMCA’s Emerging Leaders, and CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates), an organization that advocates for children in foster care.
