Outside of work, Sarah enjoys the outdoors, whether she's walking her dog Millie, spending weekends at the lake, or exploring the mountains with her husband, Andy. A lover of sunshine, family time, and interior decorating, she's also hoping to try her hand at deer hunting this year!

Name: Tina Arthur-Peterworth
Title: EHS Project Engineer
Bio:
Tina Arthur-Peterworth is an Environmental Health and Safety Project Engineer at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where she works to ensure Alabama workers understand the requirements for workplace safety and environmental compliance. Her goal is to be a resource for businesses and their employees, where she can assist them in elevating their safety and environmental programs and goals.
Tina has over 25 years of experience in the manufacturing industry. She is a Certified Hazardous Material Manager (CHMM) and a Certified Safety Professional (CSP). She is also certified in HazWoper.
Prior to joining ATN, Tina was the Environmental, Safety, Health, and Security Senior Manager for Hager Companies, where she was responsible for regulatory compliance in safety and environmental, managing workers’ compensation, and facility security. While there, she implemented and managed a safety incentive program that encouraged employee participation in safety. She also implemented a training program that ensured the employees had the necessary skills to conduct their jobs safely. Under her leadership, safety and environmental compliance were always mandated to be the standard, not the exception. Working safely is priority number one.
She earned her Bachelor’s in Business Management and her Master’s in Business Administration from the University of Phoenix. When not at work she enjoys traveling, gardening, and spending time with her family.

Name: Andrew Buttke
Title: Project Engineer - Industrial Maintenance Technology
Bio:
Andrew Buttkee is a Project Engineer in Industrial Maintenance Technology at ATN, where he develops and delivers training and technical assistance for businesses and industries, specializing in Industrial Maintenance Technology.
With 35+ years of experience in the manufacturing industry, Andrew has played a key role in launching six new manufacturing facilities, leading the development of LEAN systems, training programs, and preventive maintenance strategies that are still in use today. His expertise extends to EHS compliance, working closely with state and federal officials to ensure regulatory adherence.
Andrew's success is driven by his commitment to hiring and training a sustainable workforce, continuous learning, innovation, and dedication to the industry.
Before joining ATN, Andrew served as the Manager of Facilities Maintenance, Safety, Environmental, and Security at CMI, Inc. in Florida, overseeing daily operations, production, projects, and EHS initiatives.

Name: Peyton Moncrief
Title: LMD Training Facilitator
Bio:
Peyton Moncrief is a valued member of the Leadership and Management Development team at the Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where she supports business and industry through training and technical assistance. Her role includes delivering presentations, facilitating interactive sessions, and preparing customized training materials for ATN’s partners. Peyton is passionate about helping individuals identify and apply their personal leadership strengths within their teams to drive growth and performance.
She holds a bachelor’s degree in Business Management from Birmingham-Southern College, earned in 2016. Before joining ATN, Peyton spent several years with Chick-fil-A, where she focused on operational excellence, team development, and food safety.
Peyton is married to Dawson Moncrief. In her free time, she enjoys being with family, attending sporting events with her husband, and traveling. Her favorite adventure so far has been exploring Japan.

Name: Brian Collyer
Title: LMD Training Facilitator
Bio:
Brian Collyer is a skilled leader focused on designing and delivering training and technical support in Leadership and Management Development. With over 25 years of experience across various industries, including manufacturing and healthcare, Brian has held key training and leadership roles, consistently driving operational excellence.
Before joining ATN, Brian served as a Transformation Partner at iMpact Utah and Continuous Improvement Champion at Optum Health Care. He led impactful leadership and process improvement initiatives, including kaizen, 5S, Value Stream Mapping, and Leader Standard Work, across the five-state Mountain West Region. These efforts enhanced patient satisfaction, staff engagement, and achieved significant cost savings, while also increasing capacity.
Beyond his professional success, Brian is passionate about continuous learning and personal growth. He actively volunteers in community service, supporting organizations like the Ronald McDonald House and Blake Assisted Living. Currently, he advocates for the Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) community, exploring how robotics can enhance independent living for its members.
Brian holds a Bachelor of Arts from North Central University, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his family and friends, cooking, editing short films, hiking, playing pickleball, traveling, beach outings, and sharing plenty of laughter.

Name: David Wilbanks
Title: EHS Project Engineer
Bio:
David Wilbanks is an EHS Project Engineer at the Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he supports businesses and industries across the state through environmental, health, and safety initiatives.
With more than 35 years of experience, David has held both on-site and corporate roles in the mining and steel industries, as well as served as a principal consultant with Det Norske Veritas (now DNV GL). He holds a B.S. from Murray State University, an M.P.H. from Tulane University, and a Ph.D. from Indiana University of Pennsylvania. Before joining ATN, David was a tenured Associate Professor in the Occupational Safety & Health Department at Murray State University.
He is a Certified Safety Professional (CSP) and holds the Associate in Risk Management (ARM) designation.
Outside of work, David enjoys spending time with his family, golfing, relaxing by the beach or pool, tackling home improvement projects, and writing.

Name: Steven Moore
Title: IMT Project Engineer
Bio:
Steven Moore is a Project Engineer at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he assists clients in Industrial Maintenance by providing high-quality instruction and engineering services.
Steven has 36 years of experience in maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair. Steven also has 38 years as an instructor for the Military in the following areas, as well as experience performing the work: generator mechanic, electronics tech, and ammunition specialist.
Prior to joining ATN, Steven was the Industrial Automation Instructor for Bevill State Community College and was responsible for class development, preparation, and presentation. While there, he achieved the goal of developing a skilled workforce in the industrial maintenance field by understanding the industry's needs and then training students to a high standard of efficiency.
Steven is certified in the following:               
Maintenance Management
A graduate from R.E.T.S. Electronic Institute, Steven holds a degree in Electronic Technology. When not at work, he enjoys hunting, restoring old vehicles and riding motorcycles.

Name: Jonathan Castile
Title: Business Development Associate
Bio:
Jonathan Castile is a Business Development Associate at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he works to connect Alabama manufacturers with training, consulting, and workforce solutions that improve efficiency, safety, and growth.
Jonathan brings more than 20 years of experience in leadership, performance, and training. He has launched innovative orientation and coaching programs, guided creative projects from concept to completion, and developed strong client relationships across multiple industries—achievements made possible by his coaching mindset, adaptability, and ability to empower others.
Prior to joining ATN, Jonathan was an Orientation and Character Trainer at Universal Studios Hollywood, responsible for onboarding, skill development, and performance coaching for hundreds of employees. There, he launched innovative training initiatives that improved employee confidence, increased retention, and elevated the overall guest experience. Jonathan has completed Train the Trainer coursework and is currently pursuing certification in Personal Development Coaching.
A graduate of Austin Peay State University, he holds a degree in Theatre. When not at work, he enjoys spending time with his wife and young son, exploring creative projects like podcasting and writing, and continuing his lifelong passion for storytelling.

Name: Byron Dunkin
Title: Business Development Associate
Bio:
Byron Dunkin is a Business Development Associate at Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he works to connect Alabama manufacturers with training, consulting, and workforce solutions that improve efficiency, safety, and growth.

Byron brings more than 31 years of experience in government logistics and business development where he navigated the intricacies of federal procurement processes, fostered strong relationships with government stakeholders and identified mission-critical opportunities for innovation and efficiency. Throughout his career he has held key roles supporting a wide range of federal agencies, leading complex logistics operations, supply chain management initiatives, and acquisition strategies that align with national priorities.

From managing multimillion-dollar logistics programs to securing long-term government partnerships, Byron brings a unique blend of operational insight and business acumen. His expertise spans defense logistics, government contracting, sustainment planning, and federal business development.

A graduate of Faulkner University, he holds a Bachelor of Business Administration and a Master of Business Administration. When not at work, he enjoys spending time with family, traveling, and watching the Alabama Crimson Tide and Kansas City Chiefs.

Name: John Hilb
Title: Project Engineer
Bio:
John Hilb is the Project Engineer of Quality Management Systems and Quality Engineering at the Alabama Technology Network (ATN), where he partners with manufacturers across Alabama to strengthen quality systems, improve operational performance, and drive continual improvement. In this role, John develops and delivers targeted training, provides hands-on technical assistance, and leads projects that help companies achieve and maintain ISO and other industry quality standards.
With more than 27 years of experience in manufacturing and supply chain management, John brings extensive expertise in applying manufacturing processes and continuous improvement methodologies. He has successfully guided organizations through lean transformations, compliance initiatives, and the implementation and sustainment of manufacturing systems, all resulting in measurable business outcomes.
Before joining ATN, John held leadership roles in supply chain and plant management with several organizations. He earned his bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management from Auburn University and an MBA from the University of North Alabama, and he is certified as a Six Sigma Green Belt and APICS CPIM.
Outside of work, John enjoys spending time with his family, camping, gardening, farming, reading about history, and swimming.
